"Captain Krhinos is requested in room 1000, Captain Krhinos"

The huge workman entered the elevator and punched a button. It took
him straight at the top stair of the huge space station. He
disembarked and walked into the office of Tycoon, his entrepreneur boss.

Tycoon: Hi Krhinos. Sit down please. You've got a new mission! Energon?

Krhinos: Just a small glass, you know I'm trying to quit... So, what's
the new deal? The Tripredacus again?

Tycoon: Not this time. (He poured the liquid energon in two small
glasses and handed one to his employee.) They've offered great
contracts, but they're ending their invasion soon. They don't need any
more ore. (He sipped a little from his cup) This contractor wished to
remain anonymous, but it's going to be one of our biggest offer yet.
Basically, we have been given the mining rights for a whole planet!

Krhinos nearly choked on his energon. A planet! StarDrill Inc would
become the most profitable company in the whole system!

Krhinos: You serious, Tyke?!? A planet!? Which one just for fun?

Tycoon smiled grimly.

Tycoon: Earth! We have the rights to mine Earth! The human cradle
itself! (Seeing Krhinos's unbelieving face, he held a hand up.) Now,
now... It's the prehistoric Earth, not that rebellious headquarter of
today's.

Krhinos: What are we looking for? Iron? Radium?

Tycoon: All you can find! You get a full mobile mining base that you
can keep in orbit, a small outpost on the planet from which you can
ship the resources, I'll even grant you that Mammoth Drill you love so
much. In short, do your best! Oh... I almost forgot... I got you a few
mercenaries to bring along. They should be in the Mess Hall by now.
Take 'em along. They'll help you a lot, it's on their contract. If it
isn't, just pay them on the company's account.

Krhinos: Will do, Boss. Thanks a lot! I' make this mission pay up!

The massive bot stood up, finished his drink in a nano and saluted
Tycoon one last time before going to the Mess Hall. It was the kind of
bar where he'd expect anything, from the lowly pleasure bots to the
drunken brawls. He looked around, trying to find some relatively fresh
mercs in the crowd...
